sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: (CDRO) Risk Channels and Responsive Allocation
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg S.a. (NASDAQ: CDRO) is currently experiencing prevalent positive sentiment with a mid-channel oscillation pattern. AI models suggest three distinct trading strategies for various risk profiles, alongside multi-timeframe signal analysis indicating strong near- and mid-term signals. An exceptional 52.0:1 risk-reward short setup targets a significant downside against minimal risk.

feed.title: Codere Online Posts Higher H1 2025 Revenue but Swings to Deeper Net Loss
feed.summary: Codere Online reported increased revenue and operating income for the first half of 2025 compared to the previous year. However, heightened finance costs led to a deeper net loss and a weakened equity position despite the improved top-line performance. An analyst maintains a Buy rating on CDRO with a $14 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst Spark assesses CDRO as Neutral due to valuation and external risks.

feed.title: Sports Betting Is Booming Worldwide. Is This DraftKings Competitor Worth the Risk While Its Shares Are Under $8?
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg (NASDAQ: CDRO), a Spanish-speaking market-focused sports betting and online casino operator, presents a potentially clear path to upside despite recent struggles. Unlike competitors facing challenges from prediction market platforms, Codere's catalysts include a major sporting event in 2026, high operating leverage, and decreasing customer acquisition costs. These factors could drive significant earnings and share price growth for this small-cap stock.

feed.title: 1 Interesting Thing to Know About This Unknown Sports Betting Stock Trading Under $10
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg (NASDAQ: CDRO) is an under-the-radar sports betting stock that is outperforming U.S.-focused rivals despite not operating in North America. Its success stems from focusing on Spanish-speaking markets like Argentina, Colombia, Mexico, and Spain, positioning it well for the 2026 World Cup. The company's lack of U.S. exposure also helps it avoid regulatory risks associated with prediction markets that are impacting its American counterparts.

feed.title: Trading the Move, Not the Narrative: (CDRO) Edition
feed.summary: This article analyzes Codere Online Luxembourg S.a. (NASDAQ: CDRO), highlighting a potential long-term extension of strong near and mid-term sentiment. It identifies a mid-channel oscillation pattern with an exceptional 53.5:1 risk-reward setup, targeting a 14.5% gain versus 0.3% risk. The analysis includes AI-generated trading strategies for different risk profiles and multi-timeframe signal analysis, emphasizing positive sentiment for CDRO.

feed.title: Codere Online stock rating reiterated at Hold by Benchmark amid cost controls
feed.summary: Benchmark has reiterated its Hold rating on Codere Online Luxembourg S.A. (NASDAQ:CDRO) after the company's third-quarter 2025 financial results showed flat net gaming revenue (NGR) but improved adjusted EBITDA. The online gaming operator demonstrated disciplined cost management despite challenges such as foreign exchange pressure in Mexico and regulatory uncertainty in Colombia. Early fourth-quarter trends indicate accelerating NGR growth in Codere’s core markets, providing increased visibility toward meeting the company’s full-year 2025 guidance targets.

feed.title: Codere Online Luxembourg appoints new director and extends share repurchase authorization
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg (NASDAQ:CDRO) shareholders approved the appointment of Oscar Iglesias to its Board of Directors and voted to extend the board’s authorization to repurchase up to one million ordinary shares. The share repurchase authorization, initially set to expire on March 3, 2026, has been extended until December 31, 2026. This decision was made at an extraordinary meeting and was based on a press release filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

feed.title: Codere Online Announces EGM to Appoint New Board Member
feed.summary: Codere Online has announced an Extraordinary General Meeting (EGM) to appoint a new board member. The purpose of this EGM is to strengthen the company's governance and strategic direction. Further details regarding the proposed board member were not specified in this brief announcement.

feed.title: Codere Online Announces EGM to Appoint New Board Member
feed.summary: Codere Online (CDRO) has announced an Extraordinary General Meeting (EGM) on December 9, 2025, to appoint Gaëtan Dumont to its Board of Directors. Dumont's extensive experience in corporate finance and governance is expected to enhance the company's strategic direction. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates CDRO as Neutral, noting a stable financial position but cautioning about high valuation and external challenges.

feed.title: Codere Online Receives Delisting Notice from Nasdaq and Submits Appeal
feed.summary: Codere Online (Nasdaq: CDRO / CDROW) has received a delisting notice from Nasdaq due to its failure to file the 2024 Form 20-F. The company attributes the delay to issues with its new independent registered public accounting firm and previously filed its 2023 Form 20-F on May 1, 2025. Codere Online has appealed the delisting and requested a stay of suspension of trading, diligently working to file the overdue form by May 30, 2025.

feed.title: Codere Online (NASDAQ: CDRO) sets results release for Nov 17 at 8:30AM US Eastern Time
feed.summary: Codere Online (NASDAQ: CDRO) will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results before 8:30 AM US Eastern Time on November 17, 2025. Management will also host a conference call at 8:30 AM US Eastern Time on the same day to discuss the results and provide a business update. The earnings press release and related materials will be available on the company's website.

feed.title: Codere Online to Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
feed.summary: Codere Online announced its management will participate in two upcoming investor conferences: the 5th Annual Craig-Hallum Online Gaming Conference on December 2, 2025, and the BTIG Digital GameDay: Gaming, Gambling and Sports Betting Forum on December 10, 2025. Key management personnel, including CEO Aviv Sher and CFO Marcus Arildsson, will be attending. The company, a leading online gaming operator in Spain and Latin America, is inviting interested investors to contact representatives at the respective firms for participation details.

feed.title: Codere Online to Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
feed.summary: Codere Online, a leading online gaming operator, announced its participation in two upcoming investor conferences in December 2025: the 5th Annual Craig-Hallum Online Gaming Conference and the Digital Game Day: Gaming, Gambling and Sports Betting Forum. Management team members, including CEO Avishai S. Shemesh and Head of Investor Relations Guillermo Lancha, will be in attendance. The company, which offers online sports betting and casino services, operates in Spain, Mexico, Colombia, Panama, and Argentina, complementing Codere Group's physical presence in Latin America.

feed.title: Codere Online to Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. announced its management will participate in two upcoming virtual investor conferences: the 5th Annual Craig-Hallum Online Gaming Conference on December 2, 2025, and the BTIG Digital GameDay: Gaming, Gambling and Sports Betting Forum on December 10, 2025. Key company executives, including the CEO and CFO, will represent Codere Online at these events. Investors interested in attending should contact representatives from the respective firms.

feed.title: Codere Online (Nasdaq: CDRO) to Present at Virtual Craig-Hallum and BTIG Conferences
feed.summary: Codere Online (Nasdaq: CDRO / CDROW) announced its management will participate in two virtual investor conferences in December 2025: the 5th Annual Craig-Hallum Online Gaming Conference on December 2nd and the BTIG Digital GameDay: Gaming, Gambling and Sports Betting Forum on December 10th. The attending representatives will include CEO Aviv Sher and CFO Marcus Arildsson, among others. Investors interested in participating are advised to contact representatives from the respective conference firms.

feed.title: Stifel Maintains Codere Online Luxembourg (CDRO) Buy Recommendation
feed.summary: Stifel maintained its Buy recommendation for Codere Online Luxembourg (CDRO) on November 18, 2025. Analysts predict a 110.56% upside with an average one-year price target of $11.56/share. Institutional ownership in CDRO has increased, with 24 funds reporting positions and a 5.27% rise in total shares owned by institutions.

feed.title: Stifel lowers Codere Online stock price target to $9 on Q3 miss
feed.summary: Stifel has reduced its price target for Codere Online Luxembourg S.A. (NASDAQ:CDRO) to $9.00 from $10.00, while maintaining a Buy rating, following the company's Q3 results. The online gaming operator missed Q3 net gaming revenue expectations and reported adjusted EBITDA slightly below forecasts, attributed to peso devaluation, Colombia VAT impact, and unfavorable sports betting outcomes. Despite the miss, Codere Online reiterated its fiscal year 2025 guidance and analysts believe the company is currently undervalued given its growth potential.

feed.title: Codere Online Appoints Marcus Arildsson as Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: Codere Online (Nasdaq: CDRO / CDROW) has appointed Marcus Arildsson as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective immediately. Mr. Arildsson brings over 25 years of international finance experience from investment banking and corporate finance, including roles at Lehman Brothers, Merrill Lynch, and Arcano Partners. He succeeds Oscar Iglesias, who will transition to the Company’s Board of Directors pending shareholder approval, ensuring a seamless leadership handover.

feed.title: Codere Online Appoints Marcus Arildsson as Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: Codere Online has appointed Marcus Arildsson as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective immediately. Mr. Arildsson brings over 25 years of international finance experience and will succeed Oscar Iglesias, who is transitioning to the Company's Board of Directors. This strategic appointment aims to strengthen Codere Online's leadership as it continues to execute its growth plans in the online gaming market.

feed.title: Codere Online to Release Financial Results for the Third Quarter 2025 on November 17th
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. announced it will release its third quarter 2025 financial results on November 17, 2025, prior to 8:30 AM US Eastern Time. Management will host a conference call at 8:30 AM US Eastern Time on the same day to discuss the results and provide a business update. The press release and related materials will be available on the company's website.

feed.title: Codere Online to Release Financial Results for the Third Quarter 2025 on November 17th
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results on November 17, 2025, prior to 8:30 AM US Eastern Time. Management will host a conference call at 8:30 AM US Eastern Time to discuss these results and provide a business update. The company operates as a leading online gaming provider in Spain and Latin America.

feed.title: Codere Online Luxembourg (NASDAQ:CDRO) Trading Down 3.5% - Time to Sell? - MarketBeat
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg's stock (NASDAQ:CDRO) dropped 3.5% to $6.35, with trading volume up 53%. While the stock holds a "Moderate Buy" average rating with a $10.00 target, Weiss Ratings reiterated a "hold (c-)" rating. FNY Investment Advisers LLC significantly increased its stake in Codere Online Luxembourg by 30.8%, making it their fourth-largest holding.

feed.title: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A.'s (NASDAQ:CDRO) Price Is Out Of Tune With Revenues
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg's current price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 1.4x is comparable to the industry median despite the company's revenue growth currently outpacing most competitors. However, future revenue forecasts suggest a weaker growth rate of 9.1% annually compared to the industry's 14%, raising concerns that the stock's current P/S might be unsustainable if growth expectations are not met. Investors seem to be overlooking the more limited growth outlook, potentially setting themselves up for disappointment if the P/S ratio adjusts to align with future revenue projections.

feed.title: Codere Online Schedules Q2 2025 Earnings Call: Key Details for Investors Released
feed.summary: Codere Online (NASDAQ: CDRO) has announced that it will release its second-quarter 2025 financial results on July 31, 2025, before 8:30 AM ET. The company will also host a conference call and webcast on the same day at 8:30 AM ET to discuss the results and provide a business update. Investors can access related materials and registration links on Codere Online's website.

feed.title: Codere Online to Release Financial Results for the Second Quarter 2025 on July 31st
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. announced it will release its second quarter 2025 financial results prior to 8:30 AM US Eastern Time on July 31, 2025. Management will host a conference call at 8:30 AM US Eastern Time on the same day to discuss the results and provide a business update. The earnings press release and related materials will be available on the company's website.

feed.title: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. Files Annual 20-F Report, Regaining Nasdaq Compliance
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. has filed its annual report on Form 20-F for the year ended December 31, 2024, with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. This filing is expected to restore the company's compliance with Nasdaq Listing Rule 5250(c)(1), thus making a previously requested delisting hearing unnecessary. The company is now awaiting formal confirmation from Nasdaq regarding its compliance status.

feed.title: Codere Online files 2024 annual report with the SEC
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. has filed its annual report on Form 20-F with the SEC for the 2024 fiscal year, bringing it into compliance with Nasdaq Listing Rule 5250(c)(1) and making a delisting determination hearing unnecessary. The company recently reported its Q1 2025 financial results, with overall revenue totaling $60.8m and net gaming revenue of $63.8m, and shareholders approved a share repurchase program.

feed.title: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. Receives Delisting Determination from Nasdaq Due to Filing Delay for 2024 Form 20-F
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. faces potential delisting from Nasdaq due to its failure to timely file its 2024 Form 20-F, a delay attributed to prolonged auditing processes after engaging a new accounting firm. The company has formally requested a hearing to appeal the delisting decision and obtain a stay of suspension of trading, aiming to file the overdue form by May 30, 2025. Failure to secure an extension could result in the suspension of trading on June 6, 2025, and eventual removal from Nasdaq.

feed.title: Codere Online Reports Financial Results for the First Quarter 2025
feed.summary: Codere Online (Nasdaq: CDRO / CDROW) announced its Q1 2025 financial results, reporting €57.0 million in net gaming revenue, an 8% increase year-over-year. The company reiterated its 2025 net gaming revenue outlook of €220-230 million and Adj. EBITDA outlook of €10-15 million, driven by strong growth in Mexico. Codere Online also addressed Nasdaq compliance, having filed its 2023 annual report and expecting to file the 2024 report soon, while anticipating a delisting notice.

feed.title: Codere Online Enhances Board with New Appointment
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. has appointed Laurent Teitgen to its Board of Directors and Audit Committee, following the resignations of Taavi Davies and Claude Noesen. Teitgen's extensive experience, particularly from NeoGames S.A., is expected to bolster Codere Online’s strategic position in the online gaming sector. The company, which operates in online gaming and betting, shows a YTD price performance of 150.68% and has a "Hold" consensus rating.

feed.title: Codere Online Stock: Delisting Is A Major Concern (Rating Downgrade) (NASDAQ:CDRO)
feed.summary: Marcum has resigned as Codere Online's auditor due to IT and control deficiencies, leading to a delisting notice from NASDAQ. An appeal hearing is scheduled for January 16th, but the completion of the audit before delisting seems unlikely. Despite strong business fundamentals, the high risk of delisting has led to a rating downgrade to Hold for Codere Online shares.

feed.title: Codere Online announces new board appointments, committee changes
feed.summary: Codere Online announced new board appointments following its Annual General Meeting, with three new directors joining and CEO Gonzaga Higuero also becoming Chairman. Changes were also made to the Audit and Compliance Committees, reflecting a strategic reshuffle in the company's leadership. These resolutions, including all 21 agenda items, were favorably passed at the meeting.

feed.title: Evolution expands in Latin America with Panama slots and live casino launch
feed.summary: Evolution has broadened its market reach in Latin America by launching its online live casino and slot games in Panama through a partnership with Codere Online. This expansion builds upon existing collaborations with Codere Online across Colombia, Argentina, and Mexico. The move signifies the growing importance of the Latin American market for Evolution Group and further enhances Codere Online's offerings in the region.

feed.title: Codere Online Completes Business Combination with DD3 and Appoints Patrick J. Ramsey as Chairman of the Board of Directors
feed.summary: Codere Online has completed its business combination with DD3 Acquisition Corp. II and expects its shares to begin trading on Nasdaq under "CDRO" and "CDROW" on December 1, 2021. The transaction generated approximately $116 million in gross proceeds to fund marketing and technology investments for growth across Latin America. Additionally, Patrick J. Ramsey has been appointed as a non-executive independent director and Chairman of the Board of Directors.
